alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 29 at 9:54PM MST until December 03 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW... .Several rounds of precipitation will move through the Inland NW starting in the Cascades by early Thursday afternoon and persist into the weekend. The Cascade crest and Idaho Panhandle will get hit with heavy snow accumulations. The first widespread valley snow is forecast as well with light to moderate accumulations. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulation 1 to 2 feet in the mountains and 4 to 8 inches in the valleys. * WHERE...Dobson Pass, Fourth Of July Pass, Kellogg, Fernwood, Lookout Pass, Wallace, Mullan, Osburn, Pinehurst, and St. Maries. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Be prepared for winter driving conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow is expected Thursday Night into Friday morning, which may result in slick driving conditions. Snow intensity will likely increase Friday afternoon into Saturday morning. Look for a transition to rain in the valleys during the day Saturday with wet snow in the mountains.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
